text: hey fellow travelers March here with
Walters rule today we're into Turku
Finland my old stomping ground does
actually exchange to near many kilos and
many pounds and many years ago and today
we're going to do is answer questions
some of our fans have posted us and that
is mark how do I make friends when I
travel or how do I make friends when I
go abroad and the thing is it's not
always easy to meet people but there's
some things that I do that have really
helped me meet people I've gone around
the world and so what I'm going to do is
go through those four things the first
one is one that I was reminded of last
night by my host mom my old host mom
pedicle I love you my kids love her it's
great and she reminded me because my son
goes what's good very good as finished
she's like man I wouldn't say very good
I go I wouldn't even say good I'd say
bad shaking but she goes but you tried
and that meant something and that's what
really starts trying to speak the local
language and I'm not saying you're going
to get fluent in it don't I'm not saying
you be fluent in every language in the
world
no but if you try to speak some of the
words you're trying to do things that
really shows the locals that you really
want to be a part of that culture and
that's one of the first steps to
breaking down the barriers and meeting
people so that's what I would start with
is actually learning some of the
language the thing is sometimes just a
ketose a thank you or meet that cool
rule which is how are you like little
things like that can go a long way and
that helps it get going on and I mean
that's one of things as as I've learned
more languages I've got to make more
friends and have more conversations and
meet more people that's one of the great
things but if you don't speak it
fluently just know in a few words really
gets people to open up to you and it
gets a chance to start making friends
now the second tip I have you I actually
learned really well when I live in
Germany and that is you've got to be
like a three year old kid on a
playground and you got to keep asking
people hey you want to do something that
you want to go grab a beer hey you want
to go play some basketball you want to
kick the soccer ball around you've got
to have something to ask people to do
things and sometimes they say no and
that's okay but you have to be the one
that's going out there and doing it you
have to be the one that's making the
effort to go say hi and do stuff because
that goes a long way I know my best
friend I've ever had
magnets magnets my buddy my bro we've
been friends for like shoot it's almost
20 years now man we're getting old and I
remember we made we became friends
because we were both in the same dorm in
Germany and I came up then we were
talking a little bit like hey dude
you want to grab a drink it's like sure
and we both we ended up drinking a whole
bottle of Johnnie Walker remember we're
in college okay a whole bottle of
Johnnie Walker together and it really
kicked off for friendship but I was the
one that said hey let's do something and
you've got to do that and that kind of
leads into the third thing is when
someone asks you to do something do it
go for it you may have work you may have
homework if you're trying to meet people
you only get that one chance to make
that first impression I know it sounds
cheesy but it's so true and so what you
need to do is say hey you know what yes
I would like to go grab a drink you know
what yeah I'll go see that movie with
you because it might be the only time
they asked you to do something and I
know a lot of exchange students have
come and they've traveled and they go
and they sit online on Facebook or
snapchat or Twitter or whatever with
their friends back home and then when
the locals are wanting to meet them they
say oh no I'm going to go home and chat
with my friends well after your friends
get bored of chatting with you
you know from Belgium or wherever you're
now by yourself in that country and no
one wants to talk to you now because you
said no all the time so make sure you
say yes and go out and do things with
people and my fourth word of advice is
when you're out traveling realize that
there's people that have similar
interest to you so go do things you like
to do if you like comic books go check
out the comic book store if you like the
chimp hit the gym you like the beers go
grab some beers and when you're going
traveling you meet other travelers and
you have something in common with these
people you have something to talk about
that's why the comic books you can talk
about comic books you can talk about the
gym you can talk about sports you can
talk about travel you can say this is
where I was here's my advice here's
where you're where did you go let me
know and it gives you guys a topic to
talk about because a lot of people just
sit on their phones a lot of times and
the thing is is I know videos like mine
are helpful but getting travelers that
are just there their advice can be even
better so make sure you do do that
another one of my best friends I've ever
had Nando from Italy we met in Brazil
fishing for piranha because we just try
to talk about travel stuff and now we've

kids are best buddies it's fantastic
just because we decided you know what we

let's talk anyway if you have advice to
